public java.lang.String loginOnUserName(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        The service method called when the loginOnUserName page is reached. Retrieves an entered username and password and utilizes LoginQueries functions.
        Parameters:
        request - used to request and store information
        response -
        Returns:
        If login is correct, returns a redirect to dashboard.jsp. If login is incorrect, returns the loginfailed.jsp view.

        request - used to request and store information

                                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)

        request - used to request and store information

      • displayRoom

        @RequestMapping(value="/roomDesc",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String displayRoom(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest response)
        Gets the room Id as input from the user and uses that Id to get the rooms information. Also gets all the features of the same room and stores it in featureMap. Both of these are passed to HttpServletRequest (Should be Response) and then displayRoom.jsp is called.
        Parameters:
        request -
        response -
        Returns:
        displayRoom.jsp

      • mainService

        @RequestMapping(value="/charts")
public java.lang.String mainService(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Service method called when charts page is reached. This method serves as the main service method for charts. When the Charts page is clicked from the menu, the initial information of resource types and rooms are retrieved and put into the dropdown menus. The util value is set to -1.0 as a default so that no chart is created upon the initial page load.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest used to request and store information
        response - HttpServletResponse
        Returns:
        The utilizationChart.jsp view

      • drawChart

        @RequestMapping(value="/drawChart",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String drawChart(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Service method called when drawChart page is reached. This method gets chart parameters and converts dates to the correct, usable format. The parameters are passed back to the jsp file to create the actual utilization charts. * @param request HttpServletRequest used to request and store information
        Parameters:
        response - HttpServletResponse
        Returns:
        The utilizationChart.jsp view

      • periodTypeMethod

        private double periodTypeMethod(java.lang.String period,
                                java.util.Date day)
        Method to determine the type of period that is needed and return it (daily, weekly, monthly).
        Parameters:
        period - String used to select a period
        day - Date input from the user
        Returns:
        The periodical utilization of all resources.

      • periodTypeMethod

        private double periodTypeMethod(java.lang.String viewType,
                                java.lang.String period,
                                java.util.Date day)
        Method to determine the type of period that is needed and return it (daily, weekly, monthly).
        Parameters:
        viewType - String of resource type ID input from user
        period - String used to select a period
        day - Date input from the user
        Returns:
        The periodical utilization of a resource based on a resource type ID.
